page.title: 02Louth Markets
page.content: Louth is mentioned in guide books as being one of the best market towns in England.People come from surrounding towns and villages to visit the markets.There is the cattle,the outdoor and indoor markets.The cattle market began in 1750.It opens on Friday mornings in the spring and autumn and sells around 1000 animals a day.It deals with cattle,pigs and sheep.Both markets are in operation on Wednesdays,Fridays and Saturdays. The market hall was built in 1806.The beginning of the outdoor market is unknown to us but it is very likely that Louth grew up as a centre for bartering.The main features of the markets are the characters who can be seen there buying or selling and a chance to talk to these people can be an experience.Some say, "If you alter Louth market you will kill Louth".
